meanings.definition: The study or practice of the medicinal and therapeutic use of herbs.
meanings.sent1: In herbologies, students learn about the healing powers of different plants.
meanings.sent2: She decided to pursue a career in herbologies to help people with natural remedies.
meanings.sent3: The herbologies class had a fun project where they created their own herbal teas.
meanings.sent4: Her knowledge of herbologies was like a treasure chest full of ancient secrets.
meanings.sent5: The professor made herbologies come alive with hands-on experiments and field trips.

meanings.definition: The collection or classification of herbs.
meanings.sent1: The museum's herbologies exhibit showcased a wide variety of plants.
meanings.sent2: She enjoyed organizing her herb garden as part of her herbologies hobby.
meanings.sent3: His herbologies collection was so extensive, it filled an entire room.
meanings.sent4: The shelves in the herbologies room were lined with jars of dried herbs.
meanings.sent5: The herbologies catalog helped her keep track of all the different plants she collected.

meanings.definition: The characteristics or properties of herbs.
meanings.sent1: Understanding the herbologies of each plant is crucial for making effective herbal remedies.
meanings.sent2: She studied the herbologies of chamomile to learn about its calming effects.
meanings.sent3: The herbologies of mint include its refreshing taste and cooling properties.
meanings.sent4: The herbologies of lavender are known for their soothing and relaxing qualities.
meanings.sent5: Exploring the herbologies of rosemary revealed its potential health benefits.
